description.p: Your extraordinary skills allow you to perfom otherwise impossible feats, bend probability to your will, and transform simple playing cards into devastating arcane weapons. The defining feature of this rogue archetype is the Death Dealing Deck of cards which you enchant at 3rd level.

Death Dealing rogues learned the art of the cards from a group known at the Order of The 52. This probably apocryphal cabal of 52 rogues are said to have been the first to master the art of dealing death. To this day, some believe that there are never more than 52 Death Dealing rogues at any time. Some say The 52 are a myth while others suggest this is playing right ino their hands.

When you choose this roguish archetype at 3rd level, your understanding of playing cards deepens drastically. You are now proficient with improvised thrown weapons - including playing cards - and can add your proficiency bonus to attack rolls when throwing any improvised weapon.

If an ally within 60 feet critically hits a target you can see with a weapon or spell attack, you can use your reaction (if available) to attack the same target. If that initial target is unconscious, dead or destroyed, you may select a different target.

sheet.description: If an ally within 60 feet critically hits a target you can see with a weapon or spell attack, you can use your reaction (if available) to attack the same target. If that initial target is unconscious, dead or destroyed, you may select a different target.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you are bestowed your own magical set of cards, a Death Dealing Deck.
You also have advantage on skill checks when gambling and cheating and working with cards of any type.

description.p: You may add your proficiency bonus to death saving throws.

sheet.description: You may add your proficiency bonus to death saving throws.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can swap your position with a friendly or enemy character in initiative order. This takes effect at the start of the next round. You can do this once per combat.

sheet.description: You can swap your position with a friendly or enemy character in initiative order. This takes effect at the start of the next round.

description.p: Your bonus Sneak Attack damage can also apply to creatures you hit when you have Disadvantage on your attack roll.

sheet.description: Sneak Attack can be triggered while having Disadvantage on an attack roll.

description.p: You spend one action analyzing one target you can see within 90 feet. You make an Investigation check against their AC. If successful, for the next ten minutes, your ignore any of a target's resistances. This has no effect on immunities. If you share this information with your allies, they also bypass the target's resistances.

sheet.description: Roll an Investigation check against an enemys AC within 90 feet of you, if successful, ignore resistances for ten minutes. If this information is shared to allies, they may bypass resistances for the duration aswell.

description.p: Your skill, magic, and mastery culminate in this Roguish Archetype Feature.

While wielding a weapon with which you are proficient, if you can see the target within range, and the target is not behind complete cover, you hit the target. You cannot miss. You do not roll to hit, and the attack has neither advantage nor disadvantage/ Sneak attack damage is applied/ You can do this once per long rest.
If you're using your Death Dealing deck, a card effect is triggered. Draw a card and apply the effects.

sheet.description: Attacking an at least semi-visible target within range, with a weapon you're proficient with, will hit, do not roll to attack. Apply sneak attack damage, and if using your Death Dealing Deck, draw a card for an additional effect.

description.p: Your skill and experience with magic and cards give you a chance ti cheat fate.

If you draw a card from a magical deck and don't like the card you've drawn, you can - as a reaction - attempt to return the card to the deck as if you'd never drawn it. Your percentage chance of success is equal to your rogue level.
Example: A level-17 rogue would have a 17% chance of returning the card to the deck.

If successful, the card's effects are not triggered, the card is returned randomly to the deck as if it had never been drawn, and you quickly draw again (you can get the same card). If not successful, the card's effects play out as described.
This feature doesn't work with your Death Dealing Deck of cards.

sheet.description: If you draw a card from a magical deck and don't like what you've drawn, as a reaction, you can return the card to the deck and grab a new card. This prevents the initially drawn card from being activated.

description.p: You can use your bonus action to store your Deck in a pocket dimension. You can use another bonus action to summon it back.

sheet.description: Store or retrieve your Death Dealing Deck from a pocket dimension.

description.p: Your Deck gains a Minor Perk

Your Deck gains a minor perk of your choice at levels 7,13, and 19. Each time you level up in this class, you can change your mind and select a different Minor Perk. You must be attuned to and wielding your Death Dealing Deck to gain and/or activate any of these perks. Daily uses recharge at dawn.
Your deck gains a Major Perk

Your Deck gains a major perk of your chosie at levels 9 and 20. These perks cannot be changed once selected. You must be wielding your attuned Ddeath Dealing Deck to activate any of these perks. Daily uses recharge at dawn.

Once per day, as an action, you throw a conjured card at a creature within 60 feet. The creature must make a DC 15 dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target take 6d4 acid damage immediately and 3d4 acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes 3d4 acid damage immediately and no aditional acid damage on the next turn.

description.p: Once per day, as an action, your throw a conjured card at a point within 60 feet which projects a believable illusion in a 10-foot cube which last for 10 minuts. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it be an illusion. If a creature uses its action to examine the illusion, the creature can determine that it is unreal with a successful DC 15 intelligence. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

sheet.description: Throw a conjured card at a point within 60 feet which projects a believable illusion in a 10-foot cube for 10 minutes.

description.p: Once per day, you throw a card at a point within 40 feet. The card bursts in a 20-foot cube of radiant mist. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 dexterity saving throw or be outlined in light. For one minute, the creature sheds light in a 10-foot radius. Any attack roll against an affected creature has advantage if the target can see it, and the affected creature can't benefit from being invisible

The creature sheds light in a 10-foot radius, cannot benefit from being invisible, and any attack roll against the creature has advantage.

description.p: Your Death Dealing Deck, as an action, can transmogifry to serve as thieves tools, a crowbar, or a messkit. Use of an action can return the deck to its original, deadly form.

description.p: Twice per day, as a bonus action, you throw a conjured card at a point within 30 feet. Thick, nonmagical smoke fills a 20-foot radius, obscuring vision and blocking line of sight. The smoke lasts for 5 minutes. A moderate or strong wind will disperse the smoke are two rounds.

sheet.description: Throw a conjured card at a point within 30 feet. Thick nonmagical smoke fills a 20-foot radius, obscuring vision and blocking line of sight, the smoke lasts for 5 minutes or 2 rounds of combat.

description.p: Once per day, as an action, your Deck creates a whirlwind of lacerating cards around you. A creature takes 4d4 slashing damage when it becomes adjacent to you for the first time on a turn or starts its turn adjacent to you. This effect moves with you and lasts one minute or until your cancel it with an action.

description.p: Your own House of Cards!

Once per day, you can use an action to place your Deck on the ground and it rapidly grows into a fortress that remains until you use an Action that dismisses it. You can only dismiss the fortress if it is empty. For the Fortress' stats, see the item Instant Fortress. If the fortress is destroyed, so is your Deck of cards and a new Deck must be conjured.

sheet.description: You can place your Deck on the ground and it rapidly grows into a fortress that remains until you use an action that dismisses it. This fortress uses the stats of the item Instant Fortress and cannot be dismissed unless it is empty. If this fortress is destroyed, so is your Deck and a new Deck must be conjured.
